oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Grass Bushmen. (L V VIII.-22. 7968 rev. and 7969 re., 7976 and 7977, 7980 and 7981, 7980 rev. and 7081 rev.). A description of the Grass Bushmen and the names of places in their country. |han≠kass'o saw them at a place called 'Bushlice' and at another place there called |koro-tten. 1) See also The |goo or ≠gebbi-gu, 2) p.7980: the |xam name for the tiger moth, or larva of the genus Aloa, 3) p.7980v: names of places in the country of the `Grass Bushmen', 4) This story is found in Book VIII-22.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the 'Children of shortness' (the 'Grass Bushmen')
